alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL SOMERSET... SOUTHEASTERN WICOMICO...SOUTHWESTERN WORCESTER AND NORTH CENTRAL ACCOMACK COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Snow Hill, or 7 miles north of Pocomoke City, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Somerset, southeastern Wicomico, southwestern Worcester and north central Accomack Counties, including the following locations... Longridge, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Beaver Dam, Whiton, Girdletree, Whitesburg, New Church, and Stockton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
